test_cases.name: Create Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
preconditions: The test user account must exist and have permissions to access the specified company.
The application must have at least two existing metrics with numeric values for the Formula Builder scenarios to work.
The 'My Dashboard' must be accessible and the 'My KPIs' section must be present.
The user invitation workflow must be functional for the first scenario.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard for the selected company is loaded.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'Administration' > 'Manage Users'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Users' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click 'Invite Users' and enter the new user's email and set admin privileges.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal appears, and the user's email is entered and admin privileges are set correctly.

test_steps.action: Click 'Send Invite'.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation is sent successfully and a confirmation is shown. The new user appears in the 'Pending Invitations' section.

test_steps.action: In the 'Pending Invitations' section, click the checkmark to accept the invitation for the new user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form is displayed for the new user.

test_steps.action: Fill in the First Name, Last Name, and create a Password for the new user.
test_steps.expected_result: All required fields in the 'Accept Invite' form are filled correctly.

test_steps.action: Click 'Accept Invite' to complete the user creation.
test_steps.expected_result: The new user account is created successfully, and the page navigates back to the 'Manage Users' page or dashboard.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main navigation.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is displayed, showing a list of existing metrics.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric name is entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The Formula Builder interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the first metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is successfully added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Select a mathematical operator ('+').
test_steps.expected_result: The '+' operator is added to the formula display area next to the first metric.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the second metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is added to the formula display area, completing the formula.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula shows '(Metric 1) + (Metric 2)' in the display area.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted.

test_steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Cadence' is set to 'Weekly' and the 'Resets On' dropdown appears.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears and select a day of the week.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Resets On' dropdown is visible and the specified day is selected.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is created successfully and the user is redirected to the Metrics page.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'Dashboards' > 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens, showing available metrics on the left and selected KPIs on the right.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the left panel to the right panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the newly added metric card in the 'My KPIs' section.

test_steps.action: Hover over the newly added metric card on the dashboard to reveal the three-dot menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible on the metric card.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button and then click the 'Edit' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the Edit page for the selected metric.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options (Custom, Time-Based, None) are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: The input fields for Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 targets appear.

test_steps.action: Enter values for Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 target fields.
test_steps.expected_result: The four target level fields are populated with the specified values.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved, and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed, and the metric card now shows visual indicators for the configured Custom Target.

test_cases.name: Create Metric from Existing Metric with Quarterly Cadence
preconditions: The test user account must exist and have permissions to access the specified company.
The application must have at least one existing metric to be used as a source.
The 'My Dashboard' must be accessible and the 'My KPIs' section must be present.

test_data.Metric_to_Select: [Name of a pre-existing metric to use as source]

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard for the selected company is loaded.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main navigation.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric name is entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: An interface to search for and select an existing metric appears.

test_steps.action: Search for and select an existing metric from the search/dropdown field.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected existing metric is displayed as the source.

test_steps.action: Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Cadence' is set to 'Quarterly'.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is created successfully using the existing metric as its source.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel and click it to add it to the right panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is moved to the right panel of selected KPIs.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes. The newly created metric appears on the 'My Dashboard' in the 'My KPIs' section.
